Articles.Content:
The plan is to create a fully working orbital/surface Science lab full of customizable racks(hopefully in collaboration with kaspar racks).

Although in my opinion a rack needs to be operated and not instant science.

So i figured a Kerbal in EVA should operate it, but the kerbal should have animations to look good.

After a long and hard trial and error phase, finally i found a way to make Kerbals do custom animations.

And im ready to showcase some working functions of custom animations for EVA.

My in-game animation editor i created to help the creation of animation clips.

The editor will probably be released as a seperate plugin/project.

since the editor now resides from the rackmodule, which is not ideal.

Edited November 19, 2013 by DSSP
Update

That is a pretty cool mod. I could attach inside the KAS rack too. I think its a good idea, we need more things to put on planets and moons to make a small simple base.

Does is run smooth in game? I like movement to when a kerbal is doing science. Also like blinking lights too would add to the effect that the kerbal is punching things into the computer unit. I'm sure later on you could add sound too.

It's hard to tell quality of mod in video, if you release what you have now some people can test it out and give you feed back. I wouldn't mind checking it out.
all i have to say is.. awesome.
updated with a screenshot of in-game editor.

video edited with finished editor and better quality.

The editor will probably be released as a seperate plugin/project.

it will also be able to save/load projects and clips.

p.s. as you can see in the video some bugs still need some work

Edited November 19, 2013 by DSSP
This looks nice. It will be useful for the community, at least that's what I expect. I'll keep an eye on this.

this has lots of potential

Yes , but mod is dead .
for the love of the first kerbal, don't do that! I was just starting to get excited.

Yes , but mod is dead .

You bumped a thread to tell it is dead....really?...
Why not? Maybe some enthusiast see it and picks it up to revive it.
